name: Eiffel Tower, Paris (1)
clues: I sparkle for 5 minutes every hour after sunset.
I was once the tallest structure in the world.
fun_fact: The Eiffel Tower grows about 6 inches in summer due to heat expansion.
trivia: How many rivets were used to build me? (Answer: 2.5 million)

name: Great Wall of China (1)
clues: I stretch over 13,000 miles across my country.
Contrary to popular belief, I am not visible from the moon.
fun_fact: Some parts of the Great Wall date back over 2,000 years.
trivia: Which dynasty built the most famous sections of me? (Answer: Ming Dynasty)

name: Machu Picchu, Peru (1)
clues: I was rediscovered by Hiram Bingham in 1911.
I am a lost Incan city in the Andes Mountains.
fun_fact: Machu Picchu was never found by the Spanish conquistadors.
trivia: What does ‘Machu Picchu’ mean in Quechua? (Answer: Old Peak)

name: Statue of Liberty, USA (1)
clues: A gift from France, I hold a torch in my right hand.
My original color was brown before I turned green.
fun_fact: The Statue of Liberty’s full name is 'Liberty Enlightening the World'.
trivia: How many spikes are on my crown? (Answer: 7)

name: Taj Mahal, India (1)
clues: I was built by an emperor in memory of his wife.
My walls change color depending on the sunlight.
fun_fact: The Taj Mahal's minarets are slightly tilted outward to protect it from earthquakes.
trivia: Which Mughal emperor built me? (Answer: Shah Jahan)

name: Colosseum, Rome (1)
clues: I once hosted gladiator battles.
Despite my damage, I remain one of Rome’s biggest attractions.
fun_fact: Over 500,000 people and a million animals died in battles held at the Colosseum.
trivia: What was my original name? (Answer: Flavian Amphitheater)

name: Sydney Opera House, Australia (1)
clues: I look like a series of giant seashells.
I host over 1,500 performances every year.
fun_fact: The Sydney Opera House took 14 years to build.
trivia: Which Danish architect designed me? (Answer: Jørn Utzon)

name: Christ the Redeemer, Brazil (1)
clues: I stand tall over Rio de Janeiro with my arms wide open.
I was completed in 1931 and named one of the New Seven Wonders.
fun_fact: The Christ the Redeemer statue is 98 feet tall with a 92-foot-wide arm span.
trivia: What material is my outer layer made of? (Answer: Soapstone)

name: Pyramids of Giza, Egypt (1)
clues: I am the last surviving wonder of the ancient world.
My largest structure is named after Pharaoh Khufu.
fun_fact: The Great Pyramid was the tallest man-made structure for over 3,800 years.
trivia: How many pyramids are there in Giza? (Answer: 3 main pyramids)

name: Niagara Falls, Canada/USA (1)
clues: I am actually three waterfalls combined.
I am located on the border of two countries.
fun_fact: Niagara Falls can produce over 4 million kilowatts of electricity.
trivia: Which is the largest of the three waterfalls? (Answer: Horseshoe Falls)

clues: I sparkle for 5 minutes every hour after sunset.
I was once the tallest structure in the world.

name: Statue of Liberty, USA (10)
clues: A gift from France, I hold a torch in my right hand.
My original color was brown before I turned green.
fun_fact: The Statue of Liberty’s full name is 'Liberty Enlightening the World'.
trivia: How many spikes are on my crown? (Answer: 7)

name: Taj Mahal, India (10)
clues: I was built by an emperor in memory of his wife.
My walls change color depending on the sunlight.
fun_fact: The Taj Mahal's minarets are slightly tilted outward to protect it from earthquakes.
trivia: Which Mughal emperor built me? (Answer: Shah Jahan)

name: Colosseum, Rome (10)
clues: I once hosted gladiator battles.
Despite my damage, I remain one of Rome’s biggest attractions.
fun_fact: Over 500,000 people and a million animals died in battles held at the Colosseum.
trivia: What was my original name? (Answer: Flavian Amphitheater)

name: Sydney Opera House, Australia (10)
clues: I look like a series of giant seashells.
I host over 1,500 performances every year.
fun_fact: The Sydney Opera House took 14 years to build.
trivia: Which Danish architect designed me? (Answer: Jørn Utzon)

name: Christ the Redeemer, Brazil (10)
clues: I stand tall over Rio de Janeiro with my arms wide open.
I was completed in 1931 and named one of the New Seven Wonders.
fun_fact: The Christ the Redeemer statue is 98 feet tall with a 92-foot-wide arm span.
trivia: What material is my outer layer made of? (Answer: Soapstone)

name: Pyramids of Giza, Egypt (10)
clues: I am the last surviving wonder of the ancient world.
My largest structure is named after Pharaoh Khufu.
fun_fact: The Great Pyramid was the tallest man-made structure for over 3,800 years.
trivia: How many pyramids are there in Giza? (Answer: 3 main pyramids)

name: Niagara Falls, Canada/USA (10)
clues: I am actually three waterfalls combined.
I am located on the border of two countries.
fun_fact: Niagara Falls can produce over 4 million kilowatts of electricity.
trivia: Which is the largest of the three waterfalls? (Answer: Horseshoe Falls)
